noMisleadingCharacterClass.description:
Description

Disallow characters made with multiple code points in character class syntax.
Unicode includes the characters which are made with multiple code points. e.g. AÌ, ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ, ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘¦.
A RegExp character class/[abc]/cannot handle characters with multiple code points.
For example, the characterâ‡ï¸consists of two code points:â‡(U+2747) andVARIATION SELECTOR-16(U+FE0F).
If this character is in a RegExp character class, it will match to eitherâ‡orVARIATION SELECTOR-16rather thanâ‡ï¸.
This rule reports the regular expression literals which include multiple code point characters in character class syntax.
noMisleadingCharacterClass.option: This rule has no specific options.
